title: stencil type needs i.d
content:

fixed.

 [‹ Fields of Nephilim logo modified serif type](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185855/http:/typophile.com/node/16487 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Southlake logo script - Voluta Script, Adobe Jenson {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185855/http:/typophile.com/node/16500 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mik

comments.content: All I see is a bird with the big red “NO” symbol around it...
Mik, sort your hotlink protection out! ;)

I think this one is close...  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/rounded-stencil/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185855/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/rounded-stencil/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/rounded-stencil/")

the lowercase “e” and “t” are quite different.

custom design?

Check out Chrisafulli - it’s not a match but has a similar feel.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/crisafulli/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185855/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/crisafulli/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/crisafulli/")
It’s hard to tell from the angle of the photo, but it’s possible that the specimen font might also be a slightly extended style, so the counters may not be truly circular.
It could also have to do with the spray paint and the thickness of the stencil.
